creator: chris@w3.org
text:
For external SVG Fonts, implemented in batik, there are two equivalent ways to 
refer to them. One way, the xml font-face element and its children, is 
implemented in batik 1.5 already. The other, equivalent way using the CSS 
@font-face is not implemented in batik 1.5. The xml way is in fact a direct 
translation into xml of the CSS @font-face.

CSS is optional, but Batik already has a very good CSS implementation. This 
one part is missing.

It would be great if someone could find a little time to implement this small 
missing part:

- it would make Batik more conformant
- it would help the SVG 1.1 CR exit criteria
- it would help the CSS 2.1 exit criteria, and encourage the CSS WG to 
consider SVG implementations as wellas HTML implementations as being important.

creator: chris@w3.org
text:
Stephane, if you look in the cvs base on linux.schemasoft.com you will see 
some files to help test this:

fonts-elem-01-t.svg
fonts-elem-02-t.svg
fonts-elem-03-t.svg
fonts-elem-04-t.svg

plus an auxiliary file ../images/ext-TestComic.svg

Batik currently passes the first three tests, and not only fails the fourth 
one but gives an error message saying it is invalid CSS (which it is not).

Batik no longers considers @font-face a CSS error.  However, it still ignores 
the content of the @font-face (it is not as simple as it seems to unify
the font-face element and @font-face rule).
